The beta world I was in and testing after the update this morning, I think, there is no items in the chests, any chests that I gathered, There is no animals that I gathered just the dead meat and wool or leather. There was no items in my inventory, Nothing i had before the update was there after? Is there something I did? I dind't move, but shutt the game down to see if that was the problem it wasn't. Any thoughts? I think there was some mess up in the code

Main Issues

Any item in a chest/hopper/shulker box/furnace/smoker/blast furnace/dropper/dispenser in the Overworld is gone.

Nether Portal linking is broken. You can travel to the nether just fine but when you take portal back to the Overworld it spawns you deep underground beneath the portal. Spawn me into a lava pool when I return to Overworld. Good thing I had fire resistance potions on me.

Villagers are gone from all my farms and so far not seeing any villagers in the Overworld despite traveling 20,000 blocks away.

World generation took a turn for the worse. Massive holes in the landscape/ocean or abandon villages on mountain tops.

Any thrown tridents are gone as well.

Positive Things

It seems that items in chests that are in the Nether are fine. Not sure if its because it is a different dimension or this bug only affects the Overworld.

Items in ender chest also seem fine as well maybe it really is a Overworld only bug.

Pls update Combat on minecraft.We hate the auto clickers.Pls

I really think they should seriously consider this.

First, I think Mojang's main concern is that it would be tedious is just straight up wrong,
Spam-Tapping left click, the triggers, or your screen That's tedious, mind-numbing even (not to mention it's accessibility problems, there's no way repeatedly spamming one button repeatedly just to kill 3-5 mobs would great for your hands' health) . Combat in bedrock is easily one of it's weakest link.

Second, It would be immensely beneficial to mobile, adding an aspect of timing in combat on a device that can hit anything within it's field of vision would easily balance it without doing anything drastic.

There's already a cap on how much your hits register when you spam the attack button. They're aware of this problem yet makes no strides to fix and improve this problem. It's such an obvious solution to a problem that didn't even need to exist in the first place.

Please add a sweeping feature for swords by using a button and also axes deal more damage just like in java
Lastly add a weapon that has no cool down time

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: ‚ÄúSweeping edge‚Äù

Text: ‚ÄúAdd a sweeping edge to the bedrock edition‚Äù

- Translated by Admin.
Sa
Oh no! Watch sweeping the Pigmen!

There needs to be more sculk shriekers in both the Deep Dark and Ancient Cities. I was hoping with the Ancient Cities parity we would get the same experience in Bedrock as in Java in terms of the player needing to be cautious. But after testing several seeds in the Deep Dark this morning, it appears shrieker generation is the same as it was in the previous beta. Just as an example, entire cave hallways covered in sculk in the Deep Dark have catalysts and sensors but no shriekers, whereas in Java there can be as many as 5 or 6 along a 70-block length of hall. Same goes for the Ancient City structure. For example, a Java barracks structure I entered had 5 shriekers in it, whereas on Bedrock it had one lonely shrieker. In a corner, too far from any sensors to even matter.

As of now on Bedrock there's hardly any point to getting Swift Sneak since the odds of triggering shriekers 3 times in 10 minutes while walking normally is unlikely.
The animation of the fire of souls is missing, the lack of animation of water and lava has been preserved from the previous version

hey, I got the game a little while ago and I couldn't play with friends or on any of the servers like Mineplex or anything it says that they don't support my version and that they are working hard to is there anyway to fix that?

The deep dark biomes are looking good now, it feels more otherworldly with all the sculk. Warden changes are great and I love the sonic attack, it finally feels like a scary threat that you need to avoid. I hope the shrieker and allay buffs will come to bedrock as well.

All the new music should come to mobile minecraft as well, I'm hoping for a scary new music and ambience in the deep dark.

Bedrock mangrove biomes should try to match Java's. I think that boats should pass through lily pads without breaking them for a smoother boating experience on swamps. I'm eagerly waiting for hardcore mode and customizable mobile touch controls in the future!
When a warden shoots it's sonic boom, it immediately starts to do it's sniffing animation when mobs are around it and skips a bit of animation, and causes the chest to sometimes not open.

When a warden is about to shoot it's sonic boom, it sometimes continue to walk towards it's targeted mob, it shouldn't be able to walk while it's preparing to shoot the Sonic boom, it should be frozen.

Sometimes when a warden is targeting a mob, and another mob creates vibration, it goes to the other mob, and causes confusion on the AI and it sometimes start spinning in one place, it should stay targeted to the one mob until it kills it.

I'm not sure if this is supposed to be a thing but, the warden hears vibrations through walls and then tries to attack mobs through walls, but that doesn't seem to be a problem since it just kills them with a sonic boom.

I also think that there's not enough shriekers to summon Wardens in deep dark and ancient cities. Increase the sculk and shrieker blocks like in Java!

Allay cages need to spawn much more often in mansions and outposts. Right now they're too rare.

It's too easy to duplicate allays. Now you again have no reason to explore mansions. How about to make them duplicate only once for every unique music disk. There are 15 discs in game, meaning you would be able to produce 2^15 = 32k allays from one. 12 of the discs are renewable from skeletons and creepers, that is 4096 allays from one if you don't want to explore

This is an excellent change! Renewable allays are a must-have especially in multiplayer. They often get lost, die, and there's just not enough of them. This also gives amethyst shards a little extra use. I highly recommend adding an achievement/advancement for this, as players will not be able to figure it out.

There's still a reason to search mansions and outposts, to get the allay in the first place. But players shouldn't be forced to keep exploring more and more mansions, as exploration will cause the file size to go into the gigabytes. That causes problems for mobile & consoles.

I feel like ancient cities still need tweaking. I played 1.19 and wardens never spawned, because sensors and shriekers are very lacking. 4 shrieks to spawn wardens is too much, 3 should be enough.

In the future, zombie horses should be obtainable in survival. Undead horses are great for halloween & cemetery builds, they're the only passive undead mobs that golems won't attack. Perhaps they can spawn renewably on zombie villages, giving them a use. Mineshafts should also have a unique use; cave spiders dropping cobweb will give them a unique use (and also making cobweb renewable) and it'll be fun for tech players to create more farms.

Amethyst should still have more uses in the future. They fit very well into the End Update, perhaps to create magic staff & spells. A new system should be introduced upon entering new dimensions; you can make potions in Nether, the End needs something too.

Duplicating allay is so easy i think every allay should duplicate once and the allay that duplicated allay can't be duplicate

Or make the cooldown around 1000 minute

They shouldn't duplicate only once, it will make them non-renewable. I think this renewable method is great already. It's not too easy as you need jukeboxes, music discs, & amethyst. These rare items are finally going to have a use besides aesthetics. Players on other communities like reddit/youtube are already celebrating allay renewability.

I'm hoping that the new 1.18 & 1.19 overworld/caves music will come to mobile. Also, frog eggs should be obtainable in survival with silk touch. Please allow them to be placed on blocks and not hatch, just like turtle eggs. They make good decoration!

Block placement parity from Java is also welcome; there's lots of building tutorials out there that don't work in Bedrock edition, such as placing flower pots below blocks, placing coral fans on top of waterlogged blocks (and not die), placing lanterns/ladders on trapdoors etc.

Exploration bloats save files, and it's why I'm against rare non-renewables. The best way to deal with this issue, is to simply have portals that go to randomly generated dimensions that'll reset after, say, defeating the boss at the end of the dungeon. The 2020 april fools update had strong potential! The Ancient City portal, or perhaps a new late-game structure on the End, can achieve this. Many players prefer the combat/looting aspect of the game more so than building, and this method will make exploration truly infinite, not having to worry about your phone disk space & performance issues from large file sizes.

I think instead of duplicating allay, a fun alternative is converting vex into allay. maybe give an amethyst shard to a vex will turn it into an allay. its still renewable, but also challenging! I think that the extra challenge of giving it to a vex rather than another allay would make it more balanced, fun, and its better for the lore.
Please improve the optimization, it is terrible in 1.19.0.
Don't touch the allays anymore, they are already well balanced, sometimes the community is too whiny.

The way it is now removes the incentive to go after allays on mansions which is one thing I really liked the idea of,having them being so easily clonable is an issue.
They need to be tied to harder to access items,or may take a very long time to clone to keep the idea of rarity and going after them on mansions.
For creating more allays items like echo shards,emerald blocks ,horns ,music disks ,revival totems or  a combination of  similar items should be ideal,because they work on either their illager backstory or affinity to music.
Either way the ideal scenario is that doubling your allay count is slow and somewhat resourceful,otherwise one can output them on the hundreds if even 3 are obtained.

Even a cloning limit of 3 or 5 is fine,just to add a bit of rarity to it.
guys how to update my minecraft beta?
Hi wither

I think that duplicating allays is a very good mechanism. But in this beta, you can create as many allays as you want with one single starting allay: it is overpowered. So I think you should add a condition for duplication: there must be a certain number of allays (e.g. 10) within a certain number of blocks (e.g. 15).

I LOVE the Allay changes! The allay duplication is great for larger servers where mansions are likely to be already looted and the Allay taken. Now I only ever need a handful of Allay and if my demand goes up I can just make more. :D

Exploration in bedrock edition is much more limited than you think. Starting on 16384 blocks, 65536 blocks... you can fall through the world and die. This is marked as "won't fix" by the bu-g tracker. There are also generation issues the further you go from spawn such as missing mountains. And of course, devices like mobile have disk space limitations. Large file sizes will also harm performance. To put it simply, it's just not physically possible to explore too many mansions in bedrock edition. They tend to be over 20k blocks away, and you risk triggering these issues the further you go.

I really want exploration to be infinite in minecraft, but it's currently just not possible. I like the idea of temporary, roguelike dimensions that reset after clearing it; it's probably the only fix to this exploration issue. It also fits well in ender dimension updates. I wouldn't mind extremely rare allays and stuff, if I can explore infinitely!

Mojang should prioritize parity by adding, not removing. Removing features, though easy, just ends up making the game worse for the bedrock players, who are probably extremely frustrated at the removal of features they have used for years
There are so many examples of parity going the wrong way. Buttons on fences are another big one I miss.

I know that MCPE-187041 was not fixed correctly. Instead of properly making the leash knots bigger to adapt to walls, Mojang actually removed being able to tie leashes to walls in the 1.21.100 update. This has caused very massive problems with previously tied leashes to walls in the past, which as a result suddenly broke some adventure maps and a few redstone contraptions, as well as the fact all mobs and boats were suddenly freed from being leashed to walls.
